section.heading: Hospital benefit zones—Local public sources dedicated to finance public improvements—Reporting requirements

content.p: A local government must inform the department by the first day of March of the amount of local public sources allocated to the preceding calendar year to finance public improvements authorized under chapter 39.100 RCW.
If a local government fails to comply with subsection
of this section, no tax may be imposed under RCW 82.14.465 in the subsequent fiscal year.

A local government must provide a report to the department and the state auditor by March 1st of each year. A local government must make a good faith effort to provide information required for the report.
The report must contain the following information:

The amount of tax allocation revenues, taxes under RCW 82.14.465 , and local public sources received by the local government during the preceding calendar year, and a summary of how these revenues were expended; and

The names of any businesses known to the local government that have located within the benefit zone as a result of the public improvements undertaken by the local government and financed in whole or in part with hospital benefit zone financing.

The department must make a report available to the public and the legislature by June 1st of each year. The report must include a list of public improvements undertaken by local governments and financed in whole or in part with hospital benefit zone financing, and it must also include a summary of the information provided to the department by local governments under subsection

of this section. [ 2011 c 363 s 4 ; 2007 c 266 s 8 ; 2006 c 111 s 8 .] NOTES: Finding — Application — Effective date — 2007 c 266: See notes following RCW 39.100.010 . Effective date — 2006 c 111: See RCW 39.100.900 .
